001package org.relationlearn.model;
002
003import java.util.HashMap;
004import java.util.Iterator;
005import java.util.Map;
006import java.util.Stack;
007import org.relationlearn.exception.AlreadyExistingNodeException;
008
009/**
010 * RelationDigraph implementation that stores the ArgumentNode objects in a 
011 * Map.
012 * 
013 * @see RelationDigraph
014 * @see java.util.Map
015 */
016public class DigraphImpl implements RelationDigraph {
017    
018    private Stack<ArgumentNode> treeStack;
019    
020    private class PostorderTreeIterator implements Iterator<ArgumentNode> {
021        
022        private ArgumentNode origin;
023        
024        public PostorderTreeIterator() {
025            treeStack = new Stack<>();
026            if(DigraphImpl.this.nodeTable.size() > 0) {
027                fillStack();
028            }
029        }
030
031        @Override
032        public boolean hasNext() {
033            return !(treeStack.isEmpty());
034        }
035
036        @Override
037        public ArgumentNode next() {
038            return treeStack.pop();
039        }
040
041        @Override
042        public void remove() {
043            throw new UnsupportedOperationException();
044        }
045        
046        private void fillStack() {
047            Stack<ArgumentNode> visitStack = new Stack<>();
048            ArgumentNode start = getOrigin();
049            origin = start;
050            graphChanged = false;
051            if(start != null) {
052                visitStack.push(start);
053                while(!visitStack.empty()) {
054                    ArgumentNode node = visitStack.pop();
055                    treeStack.push(node);
056                    for(ArgumentRelation rel : node.getReplyRelations()) {
057                        visitStack.push(rel.getArgumentator());
058                    }
059                }
060            }
061        }
062        
063        private ArgumentNode getOrigin() {
064            if(graphChanged) {
065                for(ArgumentNode node : nodeTable.values()) {
066                    if(node.getTargetRelation() == null) {
067                        return node;
068                    }
069                }
070                return null;
071            } else {
072                return origin;
073            }
074        }
075        
076    }
077    
078    private final Map<Integer, ArgumentNode> nodeTable;
079    
080    private boolean graphChanged;
081    
082    /**
083     * Constucts a new empty DigraphImpl.
084     */
085    public DigraphImpl() {
086        this.nodeTable = new HashMap<>();
087    }
088    
089    /**
090     * Returns the ArgumentNode with id equal to {@code nodeId}.
091     * 
092     * @param nodeId the id of the ArgumentNode to return.
093     * 
094     * @return the ArgumentNode with id {@code nodeId} or null if 
095     * the node can't be found.
096     */
097    @Override
098    public ArgumentNode getArgumentNode(int nodeId) {
099        return this.nodeTable.get(nodeId);
100    }
101    
102    /**
103     * Adds a new ArgumentNode to this RelationDigraph.
104     * 
105     * @param node the ArgumentNode to add
106     * 
107     * @throws AlreadyExistingNodeException if there's already an
108     * ArgumentNode with the same id as {@code node}
109     */
110    @Override
111    public void addArgumentNode(ArgumentNode node) 
112            throws AlreadyExistingNodeException {
113        if(nodeTable.containsKey(node.getNodeId())) {
114            throw new AlreadyExistingNodeException();
115        } else {
116            graphChanged = true;
117            nodeTable.put(node.getNodeId(), node);
118        }
119    }
120
121    @Override
122    public boolean containsNode(int nodeId) {
123        return this.nodeTable.containsKey(nodeId);
124    }
125    
126    /** Returns a String representation of this DigraphImpl and its 
127     * content by recursively calling each ArgumentNode toString method.
128     * 
129     * @return a String representation of this DigraphImpl and its internal
130     * content
131     */
132    @Override
133    public String toString() {
134        String str = "";
135        for(ArgumentNode an : nodeTable.values()) {
136            str += an.toString() + "\n";
137        }
138        return str;
139    }
140    
141    /**
142     * Returns an Iterator that iterates through the graph's
143     * ArgumentNode objects in postorder.
144     * 
145     * <p>
146     * <b>Note: </b>This iterator expects the graph to contain an 
147     * ArgumentNode with id equal to 1, which is considered the
148     * root node (the only node that doesn't have its target relation
149     * value set).
150     * </p>
151     * 
152     * @return an Iterator that traverses the graph's nodes in postorder
153     * 
154     * @see java.util.Iterator
155     * @see java.lang.Iterable
156     */
157    @Override
158    public Iterator<ArgumentNode> iterator() {
159        return new PostorderTreeIterator();
160    }
161
162}
